definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
bit (of a bridle)/to hold in the mouth/to harbor (feelings)/to link/to accept/rank/title

sentences.english: Greeting with Iranian, you need to address their surname with their academic or job title.
sentences.chinese: 和伊朗人打招呼，要稱他們的姓加上學術或職務頭銜。

sentences.english: Tracy: She took her first beauty title when she's 21.
sentences.chinese: 她在21歲的時候首次摘取了“選美皇后”頭銜。

sentences.english: My job title is Managing Director of Yamaha Motor Racing Srl.
sentences.chinese: 我的頭銜是雅馬哈摩托競速管理董事。

sentences.english: North Korea is unlikely to be a founder member.
sentences.chinese: 朝鮮則不大可能混到一個共同體創始國的頭銜。

sentences.english: Achieved Vicious Gladiator title. Achieved Ruthle Gladiator title.
sentences.chinese: 獲得頭銜“暴藍田墨玉怒角鬥士”。

sentences.english: But there is no title I will wear more proudly than that of citizen.
sentences.chinese: 頭銜能讓我比作爲一個美國公民更爲自豪的了。

sentences.english: She's going after the Swedish baron to win the title.
sentences.chinese: 她正猛追瑞典男爵以得到貴族頭銜。

sentences.english: The title of Royal Highness was to be restricted to the Duke alone.
sentences.chinese: 殿下的頭銜僅僅授予了公爵一個人。

sentences.english: The new job means a higher salary and a better title.
sentences.chinese: 這個新的工作意味着更高的薪水和更好的頭銜。

sentences.english: The badge shows your name, the company and your job title.
sentences.chinese: 胸卡上有你的名字，公司名和頭銜。

sentences.english: Business etiquette is based on position not gender.
sentences.chinese: 在商務禮儀中，職位頭銜要比性別更爲重要。

sentences.english: Today, Professor Kao's reputation extends way beyond that of professor or even vice-chancellor.
sentences.chinese: 今天，高教授的聲名遠超他作爲教授乃至校長的頭銜。

sentences.english: Excellent moderators will be awarded a title of "The Vizir".
sentences.chinese: 對於優秀版主，我們將授予“元老”頭銜。

sentences.english: But their official titles both overrate and underrate their authority.
sentences.chinese: 但是他們官方的頭銜或多或少地估計了他們的權力。

sentences.english: So is a misspelling or inaccurate version of the job title that your applying for.
sentences.chinese: 同樣，如果你拼錯了你的工作頭銜，那也是很糟糕的。

sentences.english: Kamprad's official title with the company now is senior adviser.
sentences.chinese: 坎普拉德對外宣稱的頭銜是宜家高級顧問。

definition: the man (or woman) of the moment (idiom)/influential figure
to promote to a higher position
title granted to a person (archaic)/to ban an (online) account
special glory/distinction/rare honor/one's laurels/it's a privilege (to meet you)
person (first person, second person etc in grammar)/called/known as
legendary/fantasy saga/romance/short stories of the Tang and Song Dynasty
social status/price of a slave/price of a person (a sportsman etc)/worth/value (of stocks, valuables etc)
